page.title: 18SCHOOLS
page.content:
Dirleton School was built in 1912.It has (in 1985) 37 pupils,a headteacher and 2 full time members of staff. In 1984 the school was on the verge of closure which would have required the children to go to Gullane School. This incensed the local people who fought to retain their village school and were rewarded by it being kept open for the foreseeable future.
The present Gullane School was opened in 1978 and is open plan in design. In 1985 the number of pupils was 154 , teaching staff 7, one of whom is the headteacher-Mrs.P.Thomas. As it is a community school facilities for public use include squash courts, games hall and a committee room. The building is surrounded by large grassy playing fields.
